Body:
Description: Hi,

Customer is Turknet

Our client is deploying agents with MDM for Macbook computers. In this way, certificates are not automatically added as trusted certificates in the agent installation. Therefore, there is a problem in site access. How can we ensure that the certificate is added automatically when deploying the agent with MDM? Macbook version MacOS 15 and above.

Best regards.

What We've Learned Updated: Our Customer Turknet  want to  deploy agents with MDM for Macbook computers. In this way, certificates are not automatically added as trusted certificates in the agent installation. Therefore, there is a problem in site access. 
 Macbook version MacOS 15 and above.

Next Steps Updated: We have provided them our KB article:https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EndpointProtector_5.9.4.2/page/Content/EndpointProtector/Install/Agent/JAMF/Overview.htm , 
where they  can add the certificate while configuring the profile.

What We've Learned Updated: Our Customer Turknet  want to  deploy agents with MDM for Macbook computers. In this way, certificates are not automatically added as trusted certificates in the agent installation. Therefore, there is a problem in site access. 
 Macbook version MacOS 15 and above.

22-04 They are using a third party application to deploy the EPP MacOS client

Next Steps Updated: We have provided them our KB article:https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EndpointProtector_5.9.4.2/page/Content/EndpointProtector/Install/Agent/JAMF/Overview.htm , 
where they  can add the certificate while configuring the profile.

22-04 We provided the above kb to use it as an example and if they still encounter issue to contact the support of that third party application to assist them with the deploy.
